reviews.review:
Good Writing: 1.5 Stars
The most interesting thing about the story is the antagonist and the jokes throughout the movie. With such a large cast if left very little airtime for anyone's character to develop. Key characters make poor choices and dont utilize their abilities for the sake of drama.

Great Production: 2 Stars
A lot of time went into CGI. This is largely what the movie consists of and it does a good job. Accept for a few poor examples
The most emotional movie yet from Marvel when the Villain is surprisingly powerful, overall it is worth to watch and you won't be regret :)

Where to begin, I suppose it depends on what you seek from the Avengers and any movie.
As an action movie alone I would have given maybe 4 or 5 stars, but the Avengers and the franchise have developed into a bigger than individual superheroes punching badies up in a Jason Statham, Arnie style. While the action is exciting, and a rollercoaster, there is a lack martial art which has popped up in other Avenger movies. Also with a super dooper 'baddy' fight scenes against Thanos seem pretty pointless and other certain flaws.
Flaws are certainly abound in the plot and leaves you less than emotionally for the characters. Maybe as with each character that crumbles into the wind, might as well be dollars they would be losing if any of it was true. 
The start of the movie, was too STAR WARS NEW HOPE, maybe a statement that they hope to compete with that franchise. A bad move, the movie seems to steal many things from Star wars and LoTR / Warcraft in a weird space mix. It didnt quite work. But for Star Wars fans, we have a back story for emperor Snope. Ironman pushed him into space and he floated away into a galaxy far far away. 
Only one character had any real character progression and that was the Green chick and perhaps Thanos. 
Thanos, was a great baddy with all the aspects you expect but an ideology, like with the black panther, that is not purely evil. Thanos is not seeking in some melomaniac way all power for the universe but balance and the betterment of races. In a Socratic esq. way the curse of knowledge was certainly exposed in the movie, yet poorly done and not referred to enough.
The scene jumping didnt work for me, up until maybe halfway through. The green chic as a child was the prime example of the scene being almost random.
I feel for the money spent on the movie, and the action scenes which are very impressive. However it the plot is deeply flawed,

They pulled it off. Infinity War is an epic superhero crossover that feels seemless in bringing all the characters together and provides the excitement, the thrills and the shocking moments you'd want from the culmination of a decade of storytelling. What an experience!
Absolutely amazing film, great humor, great drama, heavy stakes and amazing performances all around and a third home run for the Russo Brothers and the writers Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely

Amazing, with so much going on, you would think that it would be very sloppy, but I literally feel like I just got to see 10 movies fuse together and create an ultimate mind blowing experience that left me wanting more!
